intro: Polygala goetzei var. depauperata, commonly known as the slender milk-vetch, is a flowering plant native to parts of China. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant has slender stems and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and usually have a hairy texture. This variant is considered a rare and lesser-known member of the Polygala genus.
